comments.text: Reporter: The "Core" product contains the rendering engine and DOM APIs. You should be able to move this bug to an appropriate DOM component there(not JavaScript).
comments.author: jlurz24@gmail.com
comments.creator: jlurz24@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Reporter: The "Core" product contains the rendering engine and DOM APIs. You should be able to move this bug to an appropriate DOM component there(not JavaScript).
See http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Whitespace_in_the_DOM - childNodes[2] is a text node, containing the whitespace between elements.

comments.raw_text: Ok, so i must remove the spaces.. i mean.. 1Some Name Well.. that's works now. I test it (the old code) on IE and Opera and works.. so i still think this is a bug The problem is not big, so i change the status to FIXED (In reply to comment #2) > See http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Whitespace_in_the_DOM - childNodes[2] > is a text node, containing the whitespace between elements.

comments.raw_text: FIXED means we checked in code to change Firefox. INVALID means you got to learn something about the differences between browsers, and about how much leeway for difference there is within the DOM spec :)
comments.creator: philringnalda@gmail.com
comments.author: philringnalda@gmail.com
comments.text: FIXED means we checked in code to change Firefox. INVALID means you got to learn something about the differences between browsers, and about how much leeway for difference there is within the DOM spec :)
